ground_truth: She's barefoot. Harry looks up at the reptilian creature. They see a baby Thestral. She takes an apple from her bag. The baby Thestral squawks. She rolls the apple to the baby. Luna throws down a piece of raw meat. Ignoring the apple, the baby Thestral flaps its wings and gobbles up the meat. Ron gobbles a sausage at breakfast. Harry approaches the table. On the stairs, McGonagall is affronted. Filch hammers in a nail and hangs a decree. Umbridge has been appointed Hogwarts' high inquisitor. Pink suede shoes stalk the corridor. Umbridge interrogates Professor Trelawney. Snape swipes Ron. The twins play tricks with a firework. Umbridge destroys it. Filch climbs a ladder. More decrees. Umbridge smiles smugly to herself. Filch swings his ladder. Students duck. He swings it back. They duck again. Trelawney gapes. Umbridge measures the height of tiny Professor Flitwick as he conducts the choir. Trelawney's eyes look round desperately behind her huge glasses. Umbridge ticks a box and leaves the classroom. Students crowd into the cloisters. Professor Trelawney stands in the courtyard, looking devastated. She sits on a trunk. Filch brings out more of her luggage. Umbridge comes out of the main door and approaches purposefully. Professor Trelawney gets up and bumps into a suitcase. She starts to weep. Umbridge is unmoved. Umbridge holds up a decree. McGonagall comforts Trelawney. The great main doors swing open. Dumbledore appears. The students watch with baited breath. Umbridge smiles a knowing smile. Harry pushes his way through the crowd of students, but Dumbledore has gone. In the common room. Harry turns up the radio. In the fire, his image fades away into the embers. A flash of lightning. Lightning illuminates the room. Hermione looks directly at Harry. Rain streams down the diamond-shaped window panes. The rain turns to swirling snow, briefly forming the face of Voldemort. The sun rises over the snow-covered village of Hogsmeade. The three friends trudge towards the decrepit Hogshead Inn. They peer inside. A goat walks through the bar. Hermione addresses around 20 students. He glances at Cho. Students shift uncomfortably. He sits down. She takes a deep breath. Harry nods. Hermione, Harry and Ron sit at a table. Walking back to Hogwarts, Harry consults his friends. Harry grins. Umbridge watches from a high tower as they return to school. Filch leans close as she gives him instructions. Neville hurries away from the bullying Crabbe and Goyle. Walking along the corridor, an odd sound causes him to stop. He turns back, bewildered. An intricate carving appears in the stone wall in front of him, and then a large archway. As Neville watches, the carved stone becomes a pair of huge, wooden double doors. The doors swing open, revealing a long room lined with shadowy mirrors.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Her bare feet touch the ground gently as she stands, while Harry raises his gaze towards the imposing reptilian creature before them. They both notice a baby Thestral nearby. She carefully reaches into her bag and retrieves an apple. The young Thestral lets out a squawk of interest. With a gentle motion, she rolls the apple towards it. Instead of the apple, Luna, seemingly without hesitation, throws down a piece of raw meat. The baby Thestral, ignoring the apple entirely, flaps its delicate wings and eagerly devours the meat. Meanwhile, Ron is busy devouring a sausage during breakfast. Harry makes his way over to the table. On the nearby stairs, McGonagall appears visibly affronted. Filch is busy, hammering a nail into the wall to hang a decree. Umbridge has been appointed as Hogwarts' high inquisitor, and the news spreads quickly. Her pink suede shoes echo ominously as they stalk the corridor. Umbridge takes it upon herself to interrogate Professor Trelawney. Snape sharply swipes at Ron. The mischievous twins entertain with their tricks involving a firework, which Umbridge promptly destroys. Filch climbs a ladder, busying himself with putting up more decrees. Umbridge, observing her surroundings, smiles smugly to herself. Filch, swinging the ladder, causes students to duck hurriedly, only for him to swing it back, resulting in the same reaction. Trelawney stands with gaping eyes. Umbridge meticulously measures the height of the diminutive Professor Flitwick as he conducts the choir. Trelawney's eyes appear desperately round behind her enormous glasses. Umbridge ticks a box with satisfaction and leaves the classroom nonchalantly. Students begin to gather in the cloisters. Professor Trelawney stands forlorn in the courtyard, looking utterly devastated. She sits down heavily on a trunk. Filch brings out yet more of her belongings. In a determined stride, Umbridge emerges from the main door and walks with purpose. Professor Trelawney rises and accidentally bumps into a suitcase, causing her to start weeping. Umbridge remains completely unmoved by the scene. Holding up a decree, Umbridge maintains her stance. McGonagall steps in to comfort the distraught Trelawney. The grand main doors swing open dramatically, and Dumbledore appears. The gathered students watch the scene unfold with bated breath. Umbridge displays a knowing smile. In the midst of the throng, Harry pushes his way through the crowd, but by then, Dumbledore has vanished. Back in the common room, Harry turns up the volume on the radio. In the flickering fire, his image gradually fades away into the glowing embers. A flash of lightning illuminates the space. Hermione turns her gaze directly towards Harry. Rain streams steadily down the diamond-shaped window panes, turning to swirling snow that briefly forms the face of Voldemort. The sun eventually rises over the snow-blanketed village of Hogsmeade. The three friends, Harry, Hermione, and Ron, trudge along towards the decrepit Hogshead Inn. They peer inside with curiosity. A goat casually walks through the bar. Hermione addresses a gathering of around 20 students. He glances briefly at Cho. The students shift uncomfortably in their seats. He sits down with determination. She takes a deep, reassuring breath. Harry nods in agreement. Hermione, Harry, and Ron settle at a table. As they walk back to Hogwarts, Harry consults with his friends. Harry's face breaks into a grin. From a high tower, Umbridge watches them as they make their return to the school. Leaning close, Filch listens intently as she gives him instructions. Neville hurries away, trying to escape the bullying Crabbe and Goyle. As he walks along the corridor, an odd sound catches his attention and causes him to stop. He turns back, visibly bewildered. In the stone wall before him, an intricate carving becomes evident and gradually transforms into a large archway. As Neville continues to watch, the carved stone seamlessly becomes a pair of huge, wooden double doors. The doors swing open, revealing a long, mysterious room lined with shadowy mirrors.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As she stands barefoot, Harry directs his gaze upwards to take in the sight of the reptilian creature before them. Together, they observe a baby Thestral making its presence known. She reaches into her bag, her fingers curling around a fresh apple, which she draws out. At that moment, the baby Thestral emits a squawk, its voice piercing the air. She gently rolls the apple across the ground towards the baby Thestral, her motion smooth and deliberate. However, with a swift motion, Luna throws a piece of raw meat onto the ground. The baby Thestral, paying no heed to the apple, begins to flap its wings vigorously before swiftly devouring the meat. Meanwhile, Ron, indulging in his breakfast, stuffs a sausage into his mouth, savoring each bite. Harry approaches the table, his steps measured and purposeful. On the staircase, McGonagall stands, her expression one of affront as she observes the scene. Filch, with focused determination, hammers a nail, his actions precise, as he hangs a new decree for all to see. The decree announces that Umbridge has now assumed the role of Hogwarts' high inquisitor. The sound of pink suede shoes echoes ominously as Umbridge stalks down the corridor with purpose. She enters the classroom, where she begins her interrogation of Professor Trelawney, her questions incisive and unrelenting. Nearby, Snape swipes at Ron with a deft motion. The twins then commence their mischief, setting off a firework with gleeful enthusiasm, but Umbridge swiftly and decisively destroys it. Filch ascends a ladder, his movements steady, as he hangs additional decrees for all to see. Umbridge observes the students with a self-satisfied smile, assured in her authority. Filch swings his ladder, causing the students to duck instinctively, only to duck again as he swings it back. Professor Trelawney stands by, her mouth agape in disbelief. Umbridge, meanwhile, measures the diminutive Professor Flitwick as he conducts the choir, her actions systematic and cold. Professor Trelawney’s eyes dart round, her desperation evident behind her oversized glasses. Umbridge, after completing her inspection, ticks a box with finality and exits the classroom. In the cloisters, students gather, their collective presence filling the space. Professor Trelawney stands in the courtyard, a figure of utter devastation, her posture slumped as she lowers herself onto a trunk. Filch arrives, burdened with more of her luggage. Umbridge emerges from the main door, striding forward with determined intent. Upon seeing Umbridge, Professor Trelawney rises, only to stumble into a suitcase, prompting her to weep, overcome with emotion. Umbridge remains impassive, holding up a decree with finality. McGonagall steps forward to offer comfort to Trelawney, her presence a balm in the tense moment. The imposing main doors of Hogwarts swing open, and Dumbledore makes his entrance, capturing the attention of the gathered students, who watch with bated breath. Umbridge greets him with a knowing smile, confident in her position. Harry, eager to witness the proceedings, pushes through the throng of students, but finds that Dumbledore has already departed. In the common room, Harry increases the volume on the radio, allowing the sound to fill the space. His image flickers in the fire before slowly dissolving into the glowing embers. A sudden flash of lightning pierces the room, momentarily illuminating it. Hermione turns her gaze directly towards Harry, her eyes searching his face. Outside, rain cascades down the diamond-shaped window panes, the droplets racing each other in intricate patterns. As if by magic, the rain transforms into swirling snow, momentarily shaping itself into the menacing visage of Voldemort. The scene shifts as the sun rises over the snow-blanketed village of Hogsmeade, casting a warm glow over the serene landscape. Harry, Hermione, and Ron trudge across the snowy ground towards the decrepit Hogshead Inn, their footsteps crunching softly with each step. They pause to peer inside the establishment, curiosity piquing their interest. A goat wanders casually through the bar, its presence adding to the Inn’s peculiar charm. Hermione gathers around 20 students, her voice carrying a note of authority as she addresses them. Harry, catching sight of Cho, glances in her direction, subtlety marking the moment. The gathered students shift uneasily, their discomfort palpable in the air. As the assembly settles, he takes a seat, ready to engage. Hermione draws a deep breath, gathering her thoughts before continuing. Harry acknowledges her words with a nod, signaling his agreement. The three friends—Hermione, Harry, and Ron—sit together at a table, their camaraderie evident in their shared expressions. As they walk back to Hogwarts, Harry consults with his friends, their conversation punctuated by nods and smiles, a plan forming between them. Harry grins, satisfaction evident in his demeanor. Umbridge, from her vantage point in a high tower, watches their return to school with a scrutinizing gaze. Filch leans in close as she whispers instructions, the nature of which remains a mystery. Neville, meanwhile, hurries away from the bullying antics of Crabbe and Goyle, their intimidation tactic a constant bother. As he proceeds along the corridor, an odd sound reaches his ears, causing him to halt, intrigued yet bewildered. He turns back, searching for the source of the sound, only to witness an intricate carving materializing in the stone wall before him, gradually taking shape. As he watches, the carved stone transforms into a pair of massive, wooden double doors. These doors swing open slowly, revealing a long room lined with shadowy mirrors, the space inviting exploration under its mysterious ambiance.

Umbridge smiles smugly to herself. Filch swings his ladder. Students duck. He swings it back. They duck again. Trelawney gapes. Students crowd into the cloisters. Professor Trelawney stands in the courtyard looking devastated. She sits on a trunk. Filch brings out more of her luggage. Umbridge comes out of the main door and approaches purposefully. Professor Trelawney gets up and bumps into a suitcase. She starts to weep. Umbridge is unmoved. test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Harry, Ron, and Hermione navigate a complex year at Hogwarts under Umbridge's rule. Luna feeds a baby Thestral while Umbridge enforces strict decrees, interrogating and dismissing Professor Trelawney, who is comforted by McGonagall. Dumbledore's unexpected intervention leaves a mysterious void as he disappears. At Hogsmeade, the trio meets with fellow students to unite against Umbridge in a secret meeting at the Hogshead Inn, with Harry exchanging glances with Cho. Meanwhile, Umbridge spies from a tower as they return to school. Neville discovers a hidden room, which opens into a chamber with mirrors, suggesting new possibilities amidst the tension.
